Description: Shoulder sherd of East Greek pottery closed vessel, amphora or oinochoe; cream slip; interior glazed at top, reserved below; exterior: black band at junction of neck and shoulder; below, black-figure decoration consisting of confronting feline and goose (of feline only one foreleg remaining, to right; of goose, to left, lower body and legs missing; added red on neck, chest, and wing); incised splinter rosette as filling ornament.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Fitzwilliam Museum, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.645)
CVA Cambridge II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum: Great Britain, Fascicule 11, Cambridge, Fascicule 2 (37, pl. 18, 40)
